meanings.definition: A ribbed woven fabric, often made of silk or rayon.
meanings.sent1: The dress was made of shiny faille fabric.
meanings.sent2: She admired the faille curtains in the living room.
meanings.sent3: The faille material felt smooth to the touch.
meanings.sent4: The faille texture added elegance to the design.
meanings.sent5: The faille pattern on the fabric caught the light beautifully.

meanings.definition: To be unsuccessful in achieving a goal or passing a test.
meanings.sent1: Despite her efforts, she would faille to win the race.
meanings.sent2: He was worried he might faille the math exam.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to jump from tree to tree but faille each time.
meanings.sent4: The team's plan to score the winning goal faille in the last minute.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick faille to impress the audience.
